from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"
LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

display(case_ref.limit(10))
print("case_ref rows:", case_ref.count())

PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"

# your prefixes
PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
    .dropDuplicates(["caseReference"])
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

ll_case = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(LLATTR_CASE_GLOB)

# Ensure join keys are same type
cases_keys = filtered_cases.select(F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string").alias("caseNodeIdKey")).dropDuplicates()

attrs_filtered = (
    ll_case
    .withColumn("ID", F.col("ID").cast("string"))
    .join(cases_keys, F.col("ID") == F.col("caseNodeIdKey"), "inner")
    .drop("caseNodeIdKey")
)

print("attrs_filtered:", attrs_filtered.count())
display(attrs_filtered.limit(5))

# Common system-ish columns we usually don't want in the final wide dataset
drop_cols = [c for c in ["DefID", "AttrID", "AttrType", "DataType", "CreateDate", "ModifyDate", "RowNum", "Partition", "FileName"] if c in attrs_filtered.columns]

attrs_clean = attrs_filtered.drop(*drop_cols)

print("Dropped cols:", drop_cols)
print("Remaining attr cols:", len(attrs_clean.columns))
